prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Chief Attorney at Fey & Co.. My boss, and a very good defense attorney.
Character 1
Name: Larry Butz
Description: The defendant in this case. A likeable guy who was my friend in grade school.
Character 2
Name: Cindy Stone
Description: The victim in this case. A model, she lived in an apartment by herself.
Character 3
Name: Winston Payne
Description: The prosecutor for this case. Lacks presence. Generally bad at getting his points across.
Character 4
Name: Frank Sahwit
Description: Discovered Ms. Stone's body. Newspaper salesman who saw Larry flee the scene.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: No one would believe I was a defense attorney if I didn't carry this.
Evidence 1
Name: Cindy's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 7/31, 4PM-5PM. Cause of death: loss of blood due to blunt trauma.
Evidence 2
Name: Statue
Description: A statue in the shape of "The Thinker". It's rather heavy.
Evidence 3
Name: Passport
Description: The victim apparently arrived home from Paris on 7/30, the day before the murder.
Evidence 4
Name: Blackout Record
Description: Electricity to Ms. Stone's building was out from noon to 6 PM on the day of the crime.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was going door-to-door, selling subscriptions when I saw a man fleeing an apartment.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 1
Testimony: I thought he must be in a hurry because he left the door half-open behind him.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 2
Testimony: Thinking it strange, I looked inside the apartment.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 3
Testimony: Then I saw her lying there... A woman... not moving... dead!
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 4
Testimony: I quailed in fright and found myself unable to go inside.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 5
Testimony: I thought to call the police immediately!
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 6
Testimony: However, the phone in her apartment wasn't working.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 7
Testimony: I went to a nearby park and found a public phone.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 8
Testimony: I remember the time exactly: It was 1:00 PM.
Person: Sahwit
Testimony 9
Testimony: The man who ran was, without a doubt, the defendant sitting right over there.
Person: Sahwit

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot: The autopsy report (Evidence 1) specifies that the victim died between 4:00 and 5:00 PM on 7/31. However, Testimony 8 states that the witness remembers the time to be exactly 1:00 PM. This is a clear contradiction between the recorded time of death and the witness's statement.

cot: Testimony 1 claims there was a table clock in the victim’s apartment, suggesting that it might have been involved in the crime. However, the only heavy object listed that could serve as a blunt instrument is Evidence 2—the statue shaped like “The Thinker.” This inconsistency between what was supposedly seen (a table clock) and what is actually on record (the heavy statue) represents a contradiction.
